column4: How do I use grub to boot to a version of linux installed on a usb drive on a system that doesn't support usb booting in the BIOS?
i do not think thats possible.. grub can only see what the bios sees. I belive...
i could be wrong.. the PuppyLinux forums I think had a thread or 2 on this topic.. and possible work arounds
i would think it may need more then just a bios update.. also Openbios only works on specific machines last i looked.
